thread.title: Young ASEAN Leaders To Visit United States On YSEALI Study Tour
thread.title_full: Young ASEAN Leaders To Visit United States On YSEALI Study Tour

title: Young ASEAN Leaders To Visit United States On YSEALI Study Tour
text: Young ASEAN Leaders To Visit United States On YSEALI Study Tour By PR Newswire | 07/20/15 - 11:11 PM EDT This regional exchange initiative, funded by a grant through the Embassy of the United States in Phnom Penh, Cambodia and administered by Cultural Vistas is part of President Obama's Young Southeast Asian Leaders Initiative (YSEALI) . The tour represents the third phase of the YSEALI Generation EARTH Regional Exchange, which began with virtual learning exercises and a four-day workshop this past April in Siem Reap , Cambodia . During the workshop, 72 young leaders from all 10 ASEAN member states worked in teams to develop project ideas addressing a transnational environmental issue. View more from the workshop at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EpKxR9SWW7I The five participants earned this opportunity by way of their team's winning proposal to develop Log This!, a youth-focused mobile application allowing users to track and submit, to their governments, cases of deforestation and illegal logging. The three-week tour includes visits to five U.S. cities, beginning in the nation's capital with subsequent stops in New York City ; Burlington, Vermont ; Duluth and Minneapolis, Minnesota ; and Seattle . While stateside, the group will meet with government and educational institutions, app developers, tech startups, community organizations and NGOs to explore environmental management best practices, and learn about resources to implement their project plan and amplify it to reach a greater audience. In each host city, the five participants will take part in various cultural and educational activities, including sharing an evening of home hospitality with an American host family. 1 of 3
